verses.verse: (Job Reproaches His Pitiless Friends) Then Job answered and said:
“I have heard many such things; (Job 13:4; 21:34) Miserable comforters are you all!
Shall words of wind have an end? Or what provokes you that you answer?
I also could speak as you do, If your soul were in my soul’s place. I could heap up words against you, And (Ps. 22:7; 109:25; Lam. 2:15; Zeph. 2:15; Matt. 27:39) shake my head at you;
But I would strengthen you with my mouth, And the comfort of my lips would relieve your grief.
“Though I speak, my grief is not relieved; And if I remain silent, how am I eased?
But now He has (Job 7:3) worn me out; You (Job 16:20; 19:13-15) have made desolate all my company.
You have shriveled me up, And it is a (Job 10:17) witness against me; My leanness rises up against me And bears witness to my face.
(Job 10:16, 17; 19:11; Hos. 6:1) He tears me in His wrath, and hates me; He gnashes at me with His teeth; (Job 13:24; 33:10) My adversary sharpens His gaze on me.

They (Ps. 22:13; 35:21) gape at me with their mouth, They (Is. 50:6; Lam. 3:30; Mic. 5:1; Matt. 26:67; Mark 14:65; Luke 22:63; Acts 23:2) strike me reproachfully on the cheek, They gather together against me.
God (Job 1:15, 17) has delivered me to the ungodly, And turned me over to the hands of the wicked.
I was at ease, but He has (Job 9:17) shattered me; He also has taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces; He has (Job 7:20; Lam. 3:12) set me up for His target,
His archers surround me. He pierces my heart and does not pity; He pours out my gall on the ground.
He breaks me with wound upon wound; He runs at me like a warrior.
“I have sewn sackcloth over my skin, And (Job 30:19; Ps. 7:5) laid my head in the dust.
My face is flushed from weeping, And on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
Although no violence is in my hands, And my prayer is pure.
“O earth, do not cover my blood, And (Job 27:9; (Ps. 66:18)) let my cry have no resting place!
Surely even now (Gen. 31:50; Rom. 1:9; Phil. 1:8; 1 Thess. 2:5) my witness is in heaven, And my evidence is on high.
My friends scorn me; My eyes pour out tears to God.
(Job 31:35; Eccl. 6:10; (Is. 45:9; Rom. 9:20)) Oh, that one might plead for a man with God, As a man pleads for his neighbor!
For when a few years are finished, I shall (Job 10:21; Eccl. 12:5) go the way of no return.
